Clinton has not laid out a four: year plan for refugees as described by Trump. She has only discussed the number of refugees to be admitted for a single year.
Clinton suggested admitting 65: 000 refugees, which would be a 550 percent increase from Obama's plan to admit 10,000 Syrian refugees in fiscal year 2016.
Clinton: s campaign did not provide any new details regarding the number of refugees her administration would admit in the future and the associated costs.
The United States already has a refugee: and Clinton has not indicated any intention to move away from it. She has emphasized the importance of the vetting process in her public remarks.
